main event: Five witnesses reported observing five bright objects in the sky in Houston, Texas on December 6, 1953.
interesting points: The objects were described as gaining altitude and following an irregular course., The observation lasted between 5 to 9 minutes., The conclusion of the report was that the objects resembled balloons., Witnesses saw the objects during clear weather conditions with a slight breeze., One of the witnesses was described as a careful observer and considered probable reliable.
sighted object: five bright objects in the sky
witness description: The witnesses included a building contractor aged 45, reported to be careful and not easily influenced.
